title: Man sets himself on fire near Parliament building, sustains 90% burn injuries - Hindustan Times
summary:
Man Sets Himself on Fire Near Parliament, Suffers Severe Injuries

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A man, identified as Jitendra from Uttar Pradesh, attempted self-immolation near the new Parliament building in Delhi, sustaining critical injuries.

  • The incident occurred around 3:30 PM near the Railway Bhawan.
  • Jitendra sustained 90% burn injuries and was taken to Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital.
  • Preliminary investigations suggest his actions may be linked to personal issues.
  • No suicide note was found, and he had previous legal troubles.
“He is around 30-35 years old,” said DCP New Delhi Devesh Mahla.

The incident highlights the ongoing mental health issues and personal struggles faced by individuals.
newTitle: Man Sets Himself on Fire Near Parliament, Suffers Severe Injuries

title: Union Minister demands Bharat Ratna for ex-Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar - OTV News
summary:
Union Minister demands Bharat Ratna for ex-Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

Date: Not specified, Source: Odishatv.in

Union Minister Giriraj Singh has demanded the Bharat Ratna, India’s highest civilian award, for Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik. Singh highlighted their transformative contributions to their respective states.

  • Sinh highlighted improvements in Bihar under Nitish Kumar.
  • He praised Kumar for lifting Bihar from the 'jungle raj' era.
  • Singh commended Naveen Patnaik's dedication and service in Odisha.
  • The demand for Bharat Ratna comes amid political tension related to upcoming Bihar Assembly elections.
  • Both BJP and JDU reaffirmed support for Nitish Kumar’s leadership for the elections.
“The contributions of such leaders should be recognised at the national level with the Bharat Ratna, as their efforts have significantly impacted the lives of millions and set benchmarks in governance,” Singh said.

This call to honour both leaders reflects the ongoing dynamics and the BJP's strategy of unity within the NDA for the 2025 elections.
newTitle: Union Minister Calls for Bharat Ratna for Nitish Kumar and Naveen Patnaik

title: Sriram Krishnan's inclusion as a policy adviser for Donald Trump sparks anti-India hate on US social media - OpIndia
summary:
Sriram Krishnan's New Role in Trump's Cabinet Ignites Controversy

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: OpIndia

Sriram Krishnan has been appointed as a Senior Policy Advisor for Artificial Intelligence by President-elect Donald Trump, stirring backlash on social media, especially from conservative circles.

  • Krishnan, a technology veteran who has worked at prominent companies, is tasked with shaping AI policy at the White House.
  • His stance on immigration, specifically regarding H1-B visas, sparked controversy and accusations of undermining Trump's America First policy.
  • Public criticism was largely driven by right-wing commentators who misrepresented his views on immigration.
  • Supporters of Krishnan clarified that his proposals aim for a merit-based immigration system.
  • Some individuals claim Krishnan prioritizes foreign workers over American citizens in technology sectors.
“I’m honoured to be able to serve our country and ensure continued American leadership in AI working closely with David Sacks. Thank you, Donald Trump, for this opportunity.” — Sriram Krishnan

The uproar reflects broader tensions surrounding immigration and the role of minorities in American politics, specifically targeting Indian-Americans like Krishnan.
newTitle: Sriram Krishnan's New Role in Trump's Cabinet Ignites Controversy

IMD issues yellow warning for heavy rainfall, dense fog in Odisha districts - OTV News
summary:
IMD Warns Heavy Rainfall & Dense Fog in Odisha

Publication Date: December 26, 2024   Source: OTV News

Several parts of Odisha are experiencing rainfall due to a well-marked low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. Heavy rainfall has been reported in Khordha and Kalahandi, with further impacts expected.

  • Heavy rainfall and light to moderate rain have been observed across various districts.
  • Future rain forecasts suggest increased rainfall in coastal and southern interior regions.
  • A yellow warning has been issued for districts likely to experience heavy rainfall.
  • Dense fog is also anticipated in several districts over the next two days.
“Heavy rainfall is very likely to occur at one or two places over several districts including Nabarangpur, Kalahandi, and Khordha.”

Residents are advised to remain cautious due to potential flooding and low visibility on the roads.
newTitle: IMD Warns Heavy Rainfall & Dense Fog in Odisha

Modi lays foundation stone of Ken-Betwa river linking project; hails Ambedkar's vision - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Launches Ken-Betwa River Linking Project, Highlights Ambedkar's Contribution

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone for the Ken-Betwa river linking project in Madhya Pradesh, emphasizing the importance of water resource management and criticizing Congress for neglecting Dr. B.R. Ambedkar's contributions.

  • The project aims to provide drinking water to approximately 65 lakh people in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.
  • It will benefit nearly 7.18 lakh agricultural families across 2,000 villages.
  • The project will involve a total cost of ₹44,605 crore.
  • PM Modi inaugurated the Omkareshwar Floating Solar Project and laid the foundation for the Daudhan Irrigation Project during the ceremony.
“The major challenge of the 21st century is water security. In the 21st century only those countries who have adequate water resources with proper management will move forward,” said PM Modi.

The Ken-Betwa project is expected to enhance prosperity in the Bundelkhand region while advancing significant developments in water management.
newTitle: PM Modi Launches Ken-Betwa River Linking Project, Highlights Ambedkar's Contribution

What's behind Centre's decision to send ex-home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla to Manipur as governor - ThePrint
summary:
What's behind Centre's decision to send ex-home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla to Manipur as governor

Publication Date: December 24, 2024
Source: ThePrint

Ajay Kumar Bhalla, former Union home secretary, has been appointed as the new governor of Manipur to address the ongoing violence and crisis that has left over 250 dead and more than 50,000 displaced since May 2023.

His extensive crisis management experience is seen as crucial in negotiating peace between the warring Kukis and Meiteis factions in the region.

  • Bhalla has a record of handling major crises including the abrogation of Article 370 and the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • He succeeds Lakshman Prasad Acharya, who previously managed the state's affairs.
  • The appointment comes amid continued unrest and challenges to law and order in Manipur.
  • Bhalla is expected to bring a different approach to managing the state's issues, leveraging his past experiences.
Former Home Secretary Bhalla to be Manipur governor. The one who couldn’t manage it from Delhi is now expected to oversee it. A sign that president’s rule may be soon imposed – after months of chaos. — K. C. Singh

The appointment of Bhalla signals a possible shift in how the Centre aims to manage the ongoing crisis in Manipur, as tensions escalate and the need for political solutions becomes more urgent.
newTitle: Ajay Kumar Bhalla Appointed Governor of Manipur Amid Ongoing Violence

Structures inside Mehrauli Archaeological Park bear religious significance: ASI tells SC - The Hindu
summary:
Structures inside Mehrauli Archaeological Park bear religious significance: ASI tells SC

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has informed the Supreme Court that two significant structures within the Mehrauli Archaeological Park hold religious value, as they are frequented by Muslim devotees.

  • The ASI noted the historical significance of the Ashiq Allah Dargah and Chillagah of Baba Farid, a revered Sufi saint.
  • An inscription reveals the tomb of Shaikh Shahibuddin (Ashiq Allah) was built in 1317 AD.
  • Renovation attempts have affected the site's historical integrity, as reported by ASI.
  • The tomb is located near Prithviraj Chauhan's citadel and is subject to strict regulatory measures.
  • The Supreme Court heard a plea for protection of these structures against potential demolition planned by the Delhi Development Authority.
“Both structures are frequently visited. Devotees light lamps at the Ashiq Dargah for fulfilment of wishes. They visit Chillagah to get rid of evil spirits and bad omen.”

The case highlights the tension between historical preservation and urban development in Delhi.
newTitle: ASI Affirms Religious Importance of Structures in Mehrauli Archaeological Park to Supreme Court

A second-year engineering student was sexually assaulted on the campus of Anna University in Chennai during the early hours of Wednesday. The assailants attacked her male friend before dragging her into the bushes.

  • The assault occurred inside the university campus.
  • Police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the attackers.
  • The survivor is a hostel resident at the university.
  • Leaders from political parties condemned the incident, highlighting issues of safety for women in Tamil Nadu.
“shameful” - Edappadi K Palaniswami, Leader of Opposition

This incident has drawn attention to significant concerns regarding women's safety in educational institutions in India, prompting widespread condemnation and calls for action.

title: GST on popcorn decoded: How much tax will you pay for the snack in movie theatres? | Mint - Mint
summary:
GST on popcorn decoded: How much tax will you pay for the snack in movie theatres?

Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

The GST treatment of popcorn has stirred considerable debate following the recent GST Council Meeting. Different taxation rates have been notified for salted and caramelised popcorn, prompting discussions on the tax implications for consumers in movie theatres.

  • Popcorn sold in loose form will have a GST of 5%, while salted and caramelised popcorn in packets will be taxed differently.
  • If popcorn is sold with a movie ticket, it may be subject to the GST rate of the ticket, as it is considered a composite supply.
  • Non-branded popcorn attracts a 5% GST, rising to 12% if sold under a brand, and further to 18% for caramelised popcorn.
  • The new GST rates aim to eliminate confusion previously caused by varying rates across states.
“Salted, caramelised, plain popcorn is being sold as namkeen in certain states. Caramelised popcorn comes with added sugar, so the treatment of rate is different from namkeen.” - Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman

The adjustments in GST rates reflect an effort to standardize taxation for popcorn sold in diverse forms at movie theatres, aimed at providing clarity for consumers and vendors alike.
newTitle: Understanding GST Rates on Popcorn in Movie Theatres

Road named after Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah in Mysuru, Opposition slams civic body - Hindustan Times
summary:
Controversy Arises as Road Named After Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah in Mysuru

Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Mysuru City Corporation's proposal to rename a road after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has sparked controversy, with the Opposition criticizing the decision as a betrayal to the people of Karnataka.

  • The proposed name for the road is Siddaramaiah Arogya Marga.
  • Opposition parties, particularly the Janata Dal (Secular), condemned the move due to allegations against Siddaramaiah related to the MUDA scam.
  • Public suggestions for the renaming were invited by the civic body, which has faced accusations of lacking an elected board.
  • Political debates surrounding the MUDA scam have intensified, leading to accusations between parties in the assembly.
“The accused A1 Siddaramaiah, who illegally obtained a site in MUDA and cheated, is facing trial in the court and Lokayukta,” said a statement from the JDS.

The decision to rename the road has ignited significant political discussion, highlighting tensions between the ruling party and the Opposition over ongoing investigations and governance issues.
newTitle: Controversy Arises as Road Named After Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah in Mysuru

title: Delhi govt departments distance themselves from AAP’s promised schemes; ask people not to share personal details - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Government Disassociates from AAP's Promised Welfare Schemes

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Delhi government has distanced its departments from the Aam Aadmi Party's welfare schemes, warning citizens against sharing personal information for non-existent programs ahead of the upcoming Assembly polls.

  • The Women and Child Development and Health departments issued public notices clarifying that they do not recognize the AAP's proposed ₹2,100 monthly aid to women and the free treatment scheme for elderly citizens.
  • Citizens were cautioned against fraudulent activities involving collection of personal data under these schemes.
  • Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed anger over the opposition's claims, alleging a coordinated effort to undermine the welfare programs.
  • The announcements were part of AAP's campaign strategy aimed at appealing to voters in the lead-up to elections in February.
  • Notices from the government reiterated that no authorized schemes were currently available for registration, urging caution in sharing personal details.
“Any private individual/political party collecting such physical forms/applications or collecting information of applicants under the name of 'Mukhyamantri Mahila Samman Yojana' is fraudulent and without any authority.”

In light of the new developments, the AAP faces significant challenges in sustaining its voter outreach efforts as the election date approaches.
newTitle: Delhi Government Disassociates from AAP's Promised Welfare Schemes

title: PM Narendra Modi To Inaugurate Ken-Betwa River Link Project On December 25 - Free Press Journal
summary:
PM Narendra Modi To Inaugurate Ken-Betwa River Link Project On December 25

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Not specified

Introduction: On the birth anniversary of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Ken-Betwa river link project on December 25 in Khajuraho.

  • The project aims to construct Daudhan dam on the borders of Chhatarpur and Panna, potentially named 'Atal Sagar Dam.'
  • It is the largest irrigation project in India, using an underground pressurized pipe system.
  • The dam will have a storage capacity of 2,853 million cubic meters.
  • A 221-km long link canal will transfer surplus water from the Ken river to the Betwa river.
  • The project will irrigate 8.11 lakh hectares across 2k villages in 10 districts, benefiting around 7 lakh farmer families.
“Around 7 lakh farmer families will be benefited by this project.”

Conclusion: The Ken-Betwa river link project is expected to significantly enhance irrigation and drinking water facilities in Madhya Pradesh, marking a step towards improved agricultural productivity.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi To Inaugurate Ken-Betwa River Link Project On December 25

title: Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus - Deccan Herald
summary:
Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus

Published Date: 25 December 2024, Source: Chennai News

The incident involved a 19-year-old engineering student who was sexually assaulted on the Anna University campus in Chennai, sparking outrage across the state.

  • The assault occurred on December 23, with the victim reporting it to the police on December 24.
  • The male friend of the victim was attacked by two unidentified men, allowing the assailants to drag the girl into bushes.
  • The Kotturpuram Police have initiated a case under relevant sections concerning sexual offenses.
  • A special police team is working to identify and apprehend the suspects using CCTV footage.
  • Political leaders have condemned the incident, blaming the government for failing to ensure law and order.
“Women don’t feel safe in the State anymore, as the Police are kept busy by the ruling administration.” - K Annamalai, Tamil Nadu BJP Chief

The incident has raised serious concerns about safety in educational institutions and the government's response to such crimes.
newTitle: Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus
